results.title: A multi-scale area-interaction model for spatio-temporal point patterns
results.abstract: This paper introduces a multi-scale area-interaction model for spatio-temporal point processes, extending the spatial model to a spatio-temporal framework. The model allows for interactions at different scales and the inclusion of covariates. It is applied to varicella cases in Valencia, Spain, revealing small-scale clustering and regularity at larger spatio-temporal scales.

results.title: Spatio-temporal determinantal point processes
results.abstract: This paper introduces spatio-temporal determinantal point processes (STDPPs) as models for regular spatio-temporal point patterns. It presents examples based on both separable and non-separable spatio-temporal covariance functions, providing a new framework for modeling repulsive point patterns in a spatio-temporal context.

results.title: Graphical modelling and partial characteristics for multitype and multivariate-marked spatio-temporal point processes
results.abstract: This paper presents a unified framework for analyzing multivariate and multivariate-marked spatio-temporal point process data. It introduces partial point characteristics and extends the spatial dependence graph model formalism. The proposed graphical model, based on partial spectral density characteristics, is computationally efficient and reflects conditional similarity among spatio-temporal sub-processes.

results.title: Robert Verity, Anne Cori, Swapnil Mishra, Seth Flaxman and Samir Bhatt's contribution to the Discussion of “Some statistical aspects of the Covid-19 response” by Wood et al
results.abstract: The paper discusses the challenges and assumptions in statistical modeling during the COVID-19 pandemic, highlighting issues like media distortion and risk framing. While agreeing on the need for reflection, the authors argue that the deconvolution framework may not be flexible enough for accurately timing infection peaks.

results.title: Model-free machine learning-based 3D single molecule localisation microscopy
results.abstract: This paper presents 'easyZloc,' a 3D single-molecule localization microscopy (SMLM) method using a lightweight Convolutional Neural Network. It is applicable to standard fluorescence microscopes, offering comparable performance to existing methods with reduced computational power and time. The method is demonstrated on nuclear pore complexes, the nuclear envelope, and actin samples.

results.title: Spatio-temporal point processes with deep non-stationary kernels
results.abstract: This paper develops a new deep non-stationary influence kernel for spatio-temporal point processes. The method uses a novel low-rank decomposition and a log-barrier penalty to efficiently model non-stationary dependencies, leading to improved computational efficiency and performance on both simulated and real data.

results.title: Deep Spatio-temporal Point Processes: Advances and New Directions
results.abstract: This article reviews the development of deep influence kernel approaches for spatio-temporal point processes (STPPs). It covers the main components of deep kernel point processes, including functional basis decomposition, graph neural networks for encoding spatial structures, and various estimation methods, while also addressing computational scalability and theoretical foundations.

results.title: Transformer-Based Neural Marked Spatio Temporal Point Process Model for Football Match Events Analysis
results.abstract: This paper proposes a Transformer-Based Neural Marked Spatio Temporal Point Process (NMSTPP) model for football event data. The model outperforms baseline models in prediction performance and is used to propose a new holistic possession utilization score (HPUS) metric for football possession analysis.

results.title: Graphical modelling and partial characteristics for multitype and multivariate-marked spatio-temporal point processes
results.abstract: This paper contributes to the multivariate analysis of marked spatio-temporal point process data by introducing different partial point characteristics and extending the spatial dependence graph model formalism. Our approach yields a unified framework for different types of spatio-temporal data including both, purely qualitatively (multivariate) cases and multivariate cases with additional quantitative marks. The proposed graphical model is defined through partial spectral density characteristics, it is highly computationally efficient and reflects the conditional similarity among sets of spatio-temporal sub-processes of either points or marked points with identical discrete marks.

results.title: Spatio-temporal determinantal point processes
results.abstract: Determinantal point processes are models for regular spatial point patterns, with appealing probabilistic properties. We present their spatio-temporal counterparts and give examples of these models, based on spatio-temporal covariance functions which are separable and non-separable in space and time.

results.title: A multi-scale area-interaction model for spatio-temporal point patterns
results.abstract: This paper proposes an extension of the spatial multi-scale area-interaction model to a spatio-temporal framework. This model allows for interaction between points at different spatio-temporal scales and the inclusion of covariates. We fit the proposed model to varicella cases registered during 2013 in Valencia, Spain. The fitted model indicates small scale clustering and regularity for higher spatio-temporal scales.

results.title: Spatio-temporal point processes with deep non-stationary kernels
results.abstract: This paper develops a new deep non-stationary influence kernel for spatio-temporal point processes. The method uses a novel low-rank decomposition and a log-barrier penalty to efficiently model non-stationary dependencies, improving performance and computational efficiency compared to state-of-the-art methods.

results.title: Deep Spatio-temporal Point Processes: Advances and New Directions
results.abstract: This article reviews the development of deep influence kernel approaches for spatio-temporal point processes (STPPs). It covers functional basis decomposition, graph neural networks for complex structures, and both likelihood-based and likelihood-free estimation methods, highlighting applications in various fields.

results.title: Transformer-Based Neural Marked Spatio Temporal Point Process Model for Football Match Events Analysis
results.abstract: This paper proposes a Transformer-Based Neural Marked Spatio Temporal Point Process (NMSTPP) model for football event data. It introduces the holistic possession utilization score (HPUS) metric for a more comprehensive analysis of football possessions, outperforming baseline models in prediction performance.

results.title: Point-process modeling of secondary crashes | PLOS One
results.abstract: In this work, we developed a self-exciting temporal point process to analyze crash events data and classify it into primary and secondary crashes.

results.title: The most distant $γ$-ray flare to date: a multiwavelength campaign on the $z = 4.715$ blazar GB6 B1428+4217
results.abstract: In November 2023, the Fermi Large Area Telescope detected a $\gamma$-ray flare from the high-redshift blazar GB6 B1428+4217 ($z=4.715$). We initiated a multi-wavelength follow-up campaign involving Swift, NuSTAR, the Sierra Nevada and Perkins Observatories, and the Effelsberg 100-m radio telescope. results.title: Advancing Event Forecasting through Massive Training of Large Language Models: Challenges, Solutions, and Broader Impacts
results.abstract: Many recent papers have studied the development of superforecaster-level event forecasting LLMs. While methodological problems with early studies cast doubt on the use of LLMs for event forecasting, recent studies with improved evaluation methods have shown that state-of-the-art LLMs are gradually reaching superforecaster-level performance, and reinforcement learning has also been reported to improve future forecasting. results.title: NANOGrav 15-year Data Set: Search for Gravitational Scattering of Pulsars by Free-Floating Objects in Interstellar Space
results.abstract: Free-floating objects (FFOs) in interstellar space$-$rogue planets, brown dwarfs, and large asteroids that are not gravitationally bound to any star$-$are expected to be ubiquitous throughout the Milky Way. Recent microlensing surveys have discovered several free-floating planets that are not bound to any known stellar systems. results.title: Measuring the Unmeasurable? Systematic Evidence on Scale Transformations in Subjective Survey Data
results.abstract: Economists routinely use survey measures of, for example, risk preferences, trust, political attitudes, or wellbeing. The literature generally treats numerical response categories as if they represent equal psychological intervals. We provide the first systematic test of this assumption, developing a general framework to quantify how easily results can be overturned when this linearity assumption is relaxed. Using original experimental data, we show that respondents interpret survey scales in ways that challenge the linearity assumption, and that this can have a substantial impact on empirical findings.

results.title: PLOS A mechanistic spatio-temporal framework for modelling individual-to-individual transmission—With an application to the 2014-2015 West Africa Ebola outbreak | PLOS Computational Biology
results.abstract: This article presents a mechanistic spatio-temporal framework for modeling the transmission of infectious diseases from one individual to another. The model is applied to the 2014-2015 Ebola outbreak in West Africa, demonstrating how it can be used to understand the dynamics of an epidemic by considering the specific locations and timings of transmissions. The method involves detailed calculations of spatial infectivity between individuals, offering a more granular view compared to traditional models.

results.title: PLOS An Accessible Method for Implementing Hierarchical Models with Spatio-Temporal Abundance Data | PLOS One
results.abstract: In ecology, understanding population dynamics across large areas and long times is a key goal. This paper presents an accessible method for creating hierarchical models that can analyze spatio-temporal abundance data, helping researchers to overcome common assumptions and make better inferences about how and why animal and plant populations vary.

results.title: PLOS Understanding spatiotemporal patterns of COVID-19 incidence in Portugal: A functional data analysis from August 2020 to March 2022 | PLOS One
results.abstract: Using data on confirmed COVID-19 cases in Portugal, this study applies functional data analysis to understand the spatiotemporal dynamics of the pandemic. The research provides scientific insights into how the incidence rates varied across different locations and times, leveraging the massive datasets collected by public health authorities.
